adjectives.description: nondescript (comparative more nondescript, superlative most nondescript)

entries.meaning: (biology, now rare) Not described (in the academic literature).

examples: He drove a nondescript silver sedan.

entries.meaning: (chiefly biology) A species or other type of creature that has not been previously described or identified. [from 17th c.]
examples: Imagination has given figure and character to centaurs, satyrs, and down to all the fairy tribe; but titles baffle even the powers of fancy, and are a chimerical non-descript.

entries.meaning: An undistinguished, unexceptional person or thing. [from 18th c.]

examples: By a nice British compromise, the enforcement car — visible just then as a white spot on the television screen — has nothing externally to show its police affiliation, but unlike the CID's nondescripts, carries two large policemen in uniform.
